page.title: 14Winbrook and Hall Farms
page.content: Winbrook early 19th C stone & slate farmhouse & buildings on medieaval site. Never part of Kelly estate. One wall damaged by World War 2 bomb. 75 acres including copice, mixed deciduous & conifers. Supports beef herd 50 Herefords.Farmer, wife, son (Frome), daughter(Plymouth). Active village life, wife WI, Hall Committee, PCC, gardening, handicrafts. Shops Chillaton, Launceston, Tavistock. Concerns; river pollution, unequal distribution food & wealth, withdrawal of local busses. Hall farm occupied for 5 years by an Irish farmer and his NZ born wife founded playgroup, children under 5. Farming beef and sheep on intensively run grassland. Well kept deciduous hedgerows.Yalford Cottages semi-detached 19th C, restored 1980's occupied by teacher & nurse, other holiday home.
